content:
Cottbus' efforts to retain young talent have shown some positive results so far. For example, the city has seen an increase in the number of students enrolled at its universities, which suggests that more young people are choosing to stay in the city for education and training purposes.

Moreover, Cottbus has seen an increase in the number of start-ups launched in the city, indicating that more young entrepreneurs are starting their own businesses, and the city's efforts to support them are paying off.

Additionally, the city's investment in cultural and recreational opportunities has contributed to the growth of social activities, as indicated by the rise of new cafes, restaurants, and other entertainment options opening up. This has helped to create a more vibrant and attractive environment for young people.

Overall, while Cottbus' initiatives to retain young talent are still in progress, the early results suggest that they are helping to make the city more attractive to a younger population. The city's continued focus on education, entrepreneurship, and the promotion of its cultural amenities and quality of life are crucial to maintaining this trend.
